channel.title: Class File Problem :(
channel.description:
Okay, I have a problem with class files...
Everytime I compile, instead of automatically making a class file, it leaves it, and I always get an error.
Is there a way to make it so you can make class files without auto making it? (I have done so) And if there is (I know you can) Everytime I add a code into it, it doesn't turn into the weird language.
And is there a way to fix my auto making class file thing?
If so.. HELP! xD

item.title: Class File Problem :(
item.dc:creator: @Enum Enum
item.description:
@Enum wrote:

  1. Download JDK 6 (java.sun.com)
  2. Install
    3.Set enviromental variables (google it)
    4.Type cd directoryHere
  3. Get to the directory with your file in it then…
    6.Type javac file.java
  4. Finish it by java file

Read full topic

item.title: Class File Problem :(
item.dc:creator: @semaphore semaphore
item.description:
@semaphore wrote:

[quote=“afferin, post:5, topic:48756”]You don’t know much about java.
Please refrain from posting here.[/quote]
wow.

If ever there was an occasion of a pot calling a kettle black this would be a stark example. Perhaps you should seriously look into a new career path as this is likely not going to work for you.

Compiling is a trivial topic. Use the search button and go do something that you probably don’t do much in school: learn.

In case you are LD or have other mental handicaps,

  1. Make sure that javac.exe is on your system path.
  2. When you compile, make sure that the directory structure of the target matches its package.
  3. Verify the classpath is correct. For the simplistic, inane things you are likely doing, simply having classpath set to ‘.’ should be fine.

Last, but not least, you are an annoying little git. You accuse the people trying to help you, who, by the way put up with your pathetic, childish babel with inhuman fortitude. If you are 11, please wait until your balls drop before posting here so that you can save yourself the trouble of proving further how little you know.

All of the above was said in as nice a tone as I could manage. Mopar, I think some people are trying to hide behind the ‘no-flame’ policy and in turn are being incredibly offensive to people that are trying to help. As I am indifferent to most individuals, occasionally I’ll come across something that I take interest in. In my opinion, afferin needs a time out or whatever else 11 year old kids get for punishment these days.

Read full topic

  2. The command prompt is referencing the correct directory when compiling/running

item.dc:creator: @afferin afferin
item.description:
@afferin wrote:

I’m trying to make mah own client.
And yeah, so it doesn’t make the class file. And I get this:

Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: EGUI Press any key to continue . . .

And I KNOW that means I need a class file, but the problem is it doesn’t make one.
:S

Read full topic

item.title: Class File Problem :(
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

Saving any Java code into a .class file isn’t going to do anything.

What error do you get when you try to compile? It has to throw an error.

Use:

@echo off javac -cp . *.java pause
